text: in my vscode editor, the tab completion for latex characters does not work; `\alpha<tab>` does not insert an alpha character as it used to. I remember it used to work some days ago, but I have no idea how I switched it off and how I can get it back.

elements.text: in my vscode editor, the tab completion for latex characters does not work;
does not insert an alpha character as it used to. I remember it used to work some days ago, but I have no idea how I switched it off and how I can get it back.

text: Are you using the insider version? <https://julialang.slack.com/archives/C6LV2R5JB/p1607631292199400>

attachments.fallback:
[December 10th, 2020 12:14 PM] hayk.saribekyan: I solved the issue by installing an old version of Julia insider (1.0.9). I think the problem was that for some reason Julia language server was not "turning on." Usually, when I open VScode, it says at the bottom - "Starting Julia Language Server." Now it doesn't do it with the normal Julia extension.

With the insider version, it tries to start the language server but the most recent version 1.0.10 takes forever. Julia insider 1.0.9 is still slow, but gets there at some point.
attachments.text:
I solved the issue by installing an old version of Julia insider (1.0.9). I think the problem was that for some reason Julia language server was not "turning on." Usually, when I open VScode, it says at the bottom - "Starting Julia Language Server." Now it doesn't do it with the normal Julia extension.

With the insider version, it tries to start the language server but the most recent version 1.0.10 takes forever. Julia insider 1.0.9 is still slow, but gets there at some point.

elements.text: Are you using the insider version?

text: Thanks for the hint! I did not recognize the server was not starting up...

elements.text: Thanks for the hint! I did not recognize the server was not starting up...

text: I thought the extension warned you loudly when it couldn't initialize the language server. I must've been misremembering

elements.text: I thought the extension warned you loudly when it couldn't initialize the language server. I must've been misremembering
